units.name: Rampart
units.prompt: Push forward aggressively. Shield_wall facing the enemy cluster. If flanked, turn to face the biggest threat. Attack when possible.

units.name: Pulse
units.prompt: Stay adjacent to the most threatened ally. Use patch on the most wounded teammate. If all healthy, use overclock on your damage dealer.

units.name: Snare
units.prompt: Trap the paths enemies must take to reach your backline. Stay at medium range. Use pulse on clustered enemies. Denial blocks adjacent threats.

units.name: Bolt
units.prompt: Maintain distance. Use precision_shot on high-value targets — medics first, then damage dealers. Use suppressing_fire if enemies close in.

units.name: Aegis
units.prompt: Push forward aggressively. Shield_wall facing the enemy cluster. If flanked, turn to face the biggest threat. Attack when possible.

units.name: Remedy
units.prompt: Stay adjacent to the most threatened ally. Use patch on the most wounded teammate. If all healthy, use overclock on your damage dealer.

actions.thinking: Round 1, all allies at full HP. No one to heal. Orders say use overclock on damage dealer if all healthy. Rampart is sentinel (not damage dealer), Snare is vector. No striker ally. Rampart is closest at (2,0), dist=2. I should move toward allies to stay adjacent. Moving to (2,1) puts me adjacent to Rampart at (2,0). Then overclock Rampart to boost their damage output next turn.

Round 1, all allies are at full HP so no healing needed. Orders say use overclock on damage dealer if all healthy - Bolt is the striker (damage dealer) at (5,4), dist=4. I need to get adjacent to Bolt. My speed is 3, so I can reach (4,4) or (5,5) to get closer. Moving to (4,4) puts me adjacent to Bolt at (5,4) - dist=1, that's adjacent. Then I can overclock Bolt.

All enemies are out of range (closest is Pulse at dist 6, my max range is 2). No targets to shoot. I'm overclocked with 2 ability uses but nothing to use them on. Orders say maintain distance — I'm already at (5,4) in the far corner, good defensive position. Move toward (5,2) to slightly close distance while staying safe, then wait.

Overclocked with 2 ability uses. No enemies in range yet. Orders say push forward aggressively and shield_wall facing enemy cluster. Enemies are NE (Bolt at 5,2) and N (Aegis at 0,4, Remedy at 4,4). Move to (4,0) to close distance toward Bolt. Then shield_wall facing N toward the enemy cluster.

Aegis is closest at dist 4, approaching from (0,4) moving south toward our backline at (0,0). I should move north to intercept and place a trap on the path between us. Moving to (0,2) puts me closer to Aegis's approach path. Then I'll trap (0,3) to catch Aegis as they advance southward.

Snare is 2 tiles away at (0,2) — I must not move adjacent. I can move to (1,4) to push forward and away from Snare's denial range. Then shield_wall facing S toward the enemy cluster (Pulse at (2,1), Rampart at (4,0)). No attack targets in range yet.
Bolt is wounded at (5,2) with 4/5 HP, dist=3. I need to move adjacent to Bolt to use patch. Moving to (5,3) puts me adjacent to Bolt at (5,2). Then I can patch Bolt.
Rampart is wounded at (4,0) with 7/8 HP, dist=3. I need to close distance to heal. Moving to (4,1) gets me adjacent to Rampart at (4,0). Then I can use patch to heal them.

Pulse is the priority target (medic, dist=2, in range). I'm at (5,2) and haven't moved yet, so precision_shot deals full 2dmg. I'll fire precision_shot at Pulse first, then move to (5,4) to maintain distance from Rampart at (4,0) and Pulse at (4,1).

Aegis is closest at dist 3 to the north. I have a trap already at (0,3). I should move north to get closer to Aegis's approach path and place another trap to funnel enemies. Moving to (1,2) keeps me off the existing trap and lets me place a trap at (1,3) or (0,4) to block Aegis's path south toward our backline.

Snare is at (1,2) — 2 tiles south, dangerous denial zone if I move adjacent. Enemy cluster is southeast. Orders say push forward and shield_wall facing enemy cluster. I can move to (2,3) to advance toward enemies while staying out of Snare's adjacent denial range. From (2,3) I can shield_wall facing S or E toward the enemy cluster. Moving first preserves fortify... wait, moving will break fortify. But orders say push forward aggressively. I'll move to (2,3) — that's diagonal advance toward enemy cluster, keeps distance from Snare (dist would be ~1.4, not adjacent). Then shield_wall facing E toward Rampart/Pulse cluster.

All enemies are out of range. Orders say push forward aggressively. Best move is toward the enemy cluster. Moving to (5,1) gets me closer to Remedy at (5,3) and Bolt at (5,4). From (5,1) I can shield_wall facing North to protect against the enemy cluster above. Pulse is at (4,1) adjacent, so shield_wall North from (5,1) could cover that flank.

All allies are at full HP, so no healing needed. Orders say to use overclock on damage dealer when all healthy. Rampart is adjacent at (5,1). I should move toward Rampart to stay adjacent and use overclock on them. Wait - Rampart is a sentinel (spd1), not the damage dealer. Snare is a vector at (1,2), dist=4, not adjacent. The damage dealer is likely Snare (vector). But I can't reach Snare this turn. Rampart is already adjacent at (5,1). I'll stay at current position or move to (5,2) to stay near Rampart and use overclock on Rampart since they're adjacent. Actually, overclock should go on the damage dealer - but Snare is too far. I'll use overclock on Rampart (sentinel) who is adjacent, as that's the best option available. I'm already adjacent to Rampart at (5,1) from my position (4,1).

All allies are at full HP, so no healing needed. Orders say to use overclock on damage dealer when all healthy. Bolt is the striker (damage dealer) at (5,4), adjacent to me at (5,3). I'll use overclock on Bolt to give them 2 abilities next turn. No movement needed since I'm already adjacent to Bolt.

I'm overclocked with 2 ability uses. Orders say medics first. Pulse is out of range at dist 4, Rampart sentinel is in range at dist 3. I can't reach Pulse from current position. Moving to (4,3) would put me dist 3 from Pulse at (4,1) — still just out of range. Moving to (4,4) keeps dist 4 to Pulse. Let me check: from (5,4) I can move to (5,2) which is dist 1 from Rampart and dist 3 from Pulse. From (4,3) dist to Pulse(4,1) = 2, which is in range! Move to (4,3) then use both precision shots on Pulse (medic, high value target).

I'm at (5,1) fortified with 2 ability uses. Remedy is closest at dist=2 to my north at (5,3). Orders say push forward aggressively. I can move to (5,2) to close in on Remedy, still out of attack range (dist=1 after move but adjacent would be needed). After moving to (5,2), Remedy at (5,3) is adjacent — I can attack! With overclocked I get 2 ability uses, so I can attack Remedy twice. Moving north to (5,2) puts me adjacent to Remedy at (5,3).

Aegis is adjacent at dist=2, within pulse range. Traps at (0,3) and (1,3) already block left flank. I should trap (2,4) or (3,3) to cut off enemy advance paths, but I'm adjacent to Aegis so trap is blocked by my own Denial passive. Pulse hits Aegis for 1dmg. I can move to (2,2) to stay at medium range and maintain pressure, then pulse Aegis at (2,3) which is dist=1 from (2,2). Actually from current pos (1,2), Aegis at (2,3) is dist=2 which is within pulse range (1 tile AoE means target must be within 1 tile). Wait - pulse range is 1 tile AoE, so I need to be within 1 tile of target. Aegis at (2,3) is dist=2 from (1,2), out of pulse range. Move to (2,2) first - then Aegis at (2,3) is dist=1, within pulse range. From (2,2) I can pulse Aegis. Also consider trap: after moving to (2,2), Aegis is adjacent so trap still blocked. Best plan: move to (2,2), pulse Aegis.

Snare is adjacent at (2,2) and has DENIAL active blocking my abilities. I can still basic attack. Snare is directly south of me — attack it to deal damage and potentially break denial. I'm fortified so I have 50% DR, but if I move I lose fortify. Orders say push forward aggressively and attack when possible. Attack Snare first, then move south toward the enemy cluster at (2,1) to press the advance. Wait — (2,1) is in valid moves list, so I can move there after attacking.

Bolt at (4,3) is adjacent to me and WOUNDED at 4/5 HP - highest priority heal. Rampart is at (5,2) adjacent to me, which blocks patch/overclock if I stay here. I need to move to (4,4) to be adjacent to Bolt while escaping Rampart's adjacency, then patch Bolt.

Rampart is at (5,2) with 7/8 HP, wounded but dist=2. Snare is at (2,2) with 8/9 HP, wounded but dist=3. I need to get adjacent to Rampart to heal. I'm at (4,1). Moving to (5,1) puts me adjacent to Rampart at (5,2) (dist=1). Then I can patch Rampart. patch is blocked if adjacent to enemy, but no enemies are adjacent to (5,1). Bolt is at (4,3), dist=2 from (5,1) - not adjacent, so patch is safe.

Priority target is Pulse (medic) at (5,1), dist=3 — outside precision_shot range (≤2). Rampart (sentinel) at (5,2) is dist=2 and in range. Orders say medics first, but Pulse is out of range at current position. If I move to (5,3), I'd be dist=2 from Pulse at (5,1) and could precision_shot the medic. Check: (5,3) is a valid move tile. From (5,3), Pulse at (5,1) is dist=2, in range. I haven't moved adjacent to Snare (stays at dist>1 from (5,3) to (2,2) = dist~3). No adjacency to enemies so precision_shot is not blocked. Move to (5,3) then precision_shot Pulse for 2dmg (1dmg since I moved). Worth it to hit the medic.

Aegis is adjacent at (2,1) - my Denial passive is already suppressing their abilities. I can't place a trap while adjacent to an enemy Vector would block it, but I'm a Vector so I need to check: trap is blocked when adjacent to enemy Vector. Aegis is a sentinel, not a Vector, so trap should be fine. I'll trap a key path tile to catch enemies funneling toward my backline, then attack Aegis with pulse since they're within 1 tile range.

Currently fortified at (2,1) with 50% damage reduction. Snare is 2 tiles away at (3,2) — moving adjacent would trigger denial. Orders say push forward aggressively and shield_wall facing enemy cluster. I can move to (3,1) which gets me closer to the enemy cluster (Pulse at (5,1), Rampart at (5,2)) without going adjacent to Snare at (3,2). From (3,1), I can shield_wall East to protect against the enemy cluster. Moving will lose fortify but I'm pushing forward per orders.

Bolt is adjacent at (5,3). I'm fortified with 50% damage reduction. Orders say attack when possible and shield_wall facing enemy cluster. I'll attack Bolt first, then shield_wall facing North to protect against Remedy at (4,4) and the enemy cluster direction.

Bolt at (5,3) is WOUNDED with 4/5 HP and dist=2, Aegis at (3,1) is WOUNDED with 6/8 HP and dist=4. Bolt is closer and more critically wounded relative to max HP. I need to move adjacent to Bolt to patch them. From (4,4), moving to (5,4) puts me adjacent to Bolt at (5,3). Snare is at (3,2) dist=3, so (5,4) keeps me safe from denial range. After moving to (5,4), Bolt at (5,3) is adjacent — use patch to heal.

Snare is wounded at (3,2) dist=3, needs heal but is not adjacent. I need to move closer to heal. Moving to (4,2) gets me dist=1 from Snare at (3,2) - adjacent for patch. But I only have 1 heal left so use it wisely. Move to (4,2) first, then patch Snare.

Pulse is the medic and high-value target at (4,2), dist=2, in range for precision_shot. I'm at (5,3) and haven't moved yet, so no movement penalty. Rampart is adjacent at (5,2) — CAUTION: being adjacent to an enemy Vector blocks precision_shot, but Rampart is a sentinel, not a vector. Snare(vector) is at dist=3, not adjacent, so precision_shot is not blocked. I can fire precision_shot on Pulse for 2dmg. After shooting, I should move to (5,5) to create distance from Rampart and maintain range on targets.

Snare is adjacent at (3,2) and has denial active blocking my abilities. I can still basic attack. Orders say push forward aggressively and attack when possible. Snare is in range for melee attack. However, using ability while in denial zone is blocked - but attack is a basic ability that should still work per the warning. I'll attack Snare at (3,2) first, then move north toward the enemy cluster at (4,1) to pressure Pulse and Rampart while staying aggressive. Moving first would lose fortify but orders say push forward.

I'm at (5,2) fortified with no enemies in melee range. Aegis is at (4,1) dist=2, Remedy at (5,4) dist=2, Bolt at (5,5) dist=3. Orders say push forward aggressively. Moving to (5,3) closes on Remedy and Bolt to the north. Then shield_wall facing N to protect Pulse at (4,2) from the northern enemy cluster (Bolt+Remedy). Moving will lose fortify but I'll be in better position to engage.

Aegis is adjacent at dist=2 and within my range. I can attack Aegis for 1 damage. My Denial passive blocks some of Aegis's abilities since they're within range. I should also consider placing a trap to control the approach path. Aegis is at (4,1), I'm at (3,2). I can attack Aegis directly. Then move to (4,3) to maintain medium range and pressure while staying away from Aegis melee range.

Patch is unavailable (0 uses left). Bolt at (5,5) is adjacent and at full HP - no heal needed. Aegis is wounded but 4 tiles away, can't reach. Rampart is adjacent at (5,3), threatening. Snare is 2 tiles away - must avoid moving adjacent to it. I can use overclock on Bolt (my damage dealer) since Bolt is adjacent at (5,5). But first I should stay near Bolt who is the most threatened ally. I'll use overclock on Bolt to boost damage output, then attack Rampart since it's adjacent.

Patch is unavailable (0 uses left). I'm at (4,2) with Aegis enemy adjacent at (4,1) - this blocks my abilities. Snare (vector) is adjacent at (4,3) and wounded. I need to move away from Aegis to use overclock on Snare. Moving to (3,2) breaks adjacency with Aegis and keeps me near Snare at (4,3) - dist 2, still not adjacent. Better: move to (4,4) puts me adjacent to Snare at (4,3) and away from Aegis. Then use overclock on Snare to give them 2 abilities next turn.

Overclocked — 2 ability uses this turn. Orders say medics first. Pulse (medic) is wounded at (4,4), distance 2, in range. I haven't moved so precision_shot deals full 2dmg — likely finishing Pulse. Then use second ability on Rampart (sentinel) at (5,3), distance 2, also in range for precision_shot. Staying at (5,5) keeps me 3 tiles from Snare, avoiding adjacency denial. No need to move.

I'm overclocked with 2 ability uses. Remedy (medic) is at (5,4) distance 2 - in range. Aegis (sentinel) is at (4,1) distance 2 - in range. I should use pulse to hit clustered enemies. Remedy is at (5,4) and I'm at (4,3) - that's adjacent diagonally but pulse hits within 1 tile. Actually pulse hits ALL units within 1 tile of target. If I pulse at (5,4) I hit Remedy. If I pulse at (4,3) (my position) I hit any adjacent units. Remedy at (5,4) is distance 2 from me so not within 1 tile of my position. Best play: use pulse targeting (5,4) to hit Remedy, then trap a key approach tile. Aegis is approaching from (4,1) heading N - I could trap (4,2) to intercept. With overclocked I get 2 ability uses, so: pulse at Remedy, then trap at (4,2) to block Aegis advance. No move needed to stay at range.

I'm fortified at (4,1) with 50% damage reduction. Orders say push forward aggressively and shield_wall facing the enemy cluster. The enemy cluster is north: Snare@(4,3), Pulse@(4,4), Rampart@(5,3). I need to move closer but avoid going adjacent to Snare which would block my abilities. Moving to (4,2) puts me 1 tile from Snare — that's adjacent, which triggers denial. Moving to (5,2) keeps me 1 tile from Snare diagonally (dist=2 from (4,3) to (5,2) = sqrt(2) ≈ 1.4, but grid distance is max(1,1)=1 — still adjacent). Better to move to (3,2) or (5,1) to stay clear. Actually (5,2) is distance 1 from Snare@(4,3) — adjacent. (3,2) is distance 2 from Snare — safe. But orders say push forward aggressively. Let me check (5,2): dist to Snare@(4,3) = |5-4|+|2-3|=2 — that's 2 tiles, not adjacent! The caution says avoid moving adjacent (dist=1). So (5,2) is safe at dist=2. From (5,2) I can shield_wall N to protect allies from the northern enemy cluster. This advances me and covers allies Bolt@(5,5) and Remedy@(5,4) from threats coming from north.

I'm at (5,3) with 5/8 HP, fortified. Remedy (medic) is adjacent at (5,4) to my north - priority target to deny healing. Aegis (sentinel) is adjacent at (5,2) to my south. Orders say push forward and attack. Remedy is the bigger threat since it can heal the enemy team. I'll attack Remedy first, then shield_wall facing north to protect against Bolt at (5,5) and block the enemy cluster. Staying put preserves fortify for damage reduction.

Patch is unavailable (0/3 remaining). Bolt at (5,5) is adjacent (dist=1) and wounded at 4/5HP — I can use overclock on Bolt to give them 2 abilities next turn, which helps deal with the clustered enemies. I'm currently at (5,4). Snare is at dist=2 so I'm safe here. Pulse is critical at (4,4) — I could attack Pulse to finish them off. I'll use overclock on Bolt first (adjacent at 5,5), then attack Pulse at (4,4) to eliminate the enemy medic.

I'm at 2/12 HP - critically low. No heals remaining. Remedy (enemy medic) is adjacent at (5,4), blocking my abilities. I need to move away from Remedy to survive. Snare is wounded and adjacent at (4,3) but I can't heal anyway. My priority is survival - move away from the enemy medic. Moving to (3,4) gets me away from Remedy and keeps me near allies. Then I can use overclock on Snare if I can get adjacent, but first I need to not die.

I have OVERCLOCKED status giving me 2 ability uses. Priority targets: Pulse(medic) is critical and must be eliminated first. Pulse is at (3,4) dist=3 — outside precision_shot range of ≤2 tiles from current position (5,5). Rampart(sentinel) is at (5,3) dist=2, in range. Snare(vector) at (4,3) is 3 tiles away — I must NOT move adjacent to it. If I move to (4,5), Pulse at (3,4) would be dist=2 (|4-3|+|5-4|=2), bringing it in precision_shot range. But Snare is at (4,3) — moving to (4,5) keeps me 2 tiles from Snare (safe). From (4,5): Pulse at (3,4) is dist=2, in range for precision_shot. Rampart at (5,3) is dist=3, out of precision_shot range. Plan: Move to (4,5), then use precision_shot on Pulse (critical medic, kill priority), then use second ability precision_shot on Rampart if in range — wait, from (4,5) Rampart is at dist=3, out of range. Better: stay at (5,5), use both precision_shots. From (5,5): Pulse is dist=3 — NOT in precision_shot range (≤2). Rampart is dist=2, in range. So I should move to (4,5) first to get Pulse in range, then shoot Pulse. Second ability: from (4,5), Rampart is dist=3 — can't shoot. Snare is dist=2 at (4,3) — adjacent would be blocked but dist=2 is fine for precision_shot, but orders say medics first. Use suppressing_fire on Rampart to slow it? Or just shoot Pulse twice isn't possible from one position. Move to (4,5), shoot Pulse (critical, eliminate), second shot — from (4,5) check Snare at (4,3) dist=2, healthy vector. Orders say medics first then damage dealers. With Pulse eliminated, use second ability on Snare or Rampart. Snare at dist=2 from (4,5) is valid for precision_shot. Final plan: move to (4,5), precision_shot Pulse, precision_shot Snare.

Rampart is adjacent at (5,3) to the north. I'm fortified with 50% damage reduction. Orders say attack when possible and shield_wall facing enemy cluster. I'll attack Rampart first, then shield_wall facing North to block incoming damage from Rampart and protect Remedy behind me. Staying put preserves Fortify for next turn if I don't move.

I'm at (5,3) with fortify active (50% DR). Aegis is adjacent at (5,2) and Remedy is adjacent at (5,4). Orders say attack when possible and shield_wall facing enemy cluster. Aegis is a sentinel enemy - attacking it is useful. I should shield_wall to protect against the enemy cluster. If I move I lose fortify. Best play: shield_wall facing S to cover against Aegis at (5,2), then attack Aegis. Wait - shield_wall direction should face the enemy cluster. Aegis is at (5,2) which is south of me. Remedy is at (5,4) which is north. Bolt is at (4,5) northwest. The bigger threat cluster is south (Aegis) plus Bolt coming from northwest. I'll shield_wall facing S to block Aegis, then attack Aegis to deal damage. Staying put preserves fortify.

Bolt is wounded at (4,5) distance 2 - pulse would hit them. Remedy is healthy at (5,4) also distance 2 - adjacent to Bolt, so pulse hits both. Aegis is at (5,2) distance 2. My trap at (4,2) is already placed. I should pulse to hit Bolt+Remedy cluster, then move to maintain positioning. Pulse hits all units within 1 tile - from (4,3), Bolt at (4,5) is dist 2 so out of pulse range. Let me reconsider: pulse range is 1 tile AoE. Bolt at (4,5) is 2 away, Remedy at (5,4) is 2 away - neither in pulse range from current position. I could move to (4,4) to get adjacent to Bolt at (4,5) and Remedy at (5,4) - but that puts me next to enemies. Better to trap approach paths. Move to (3,3) and trap (4,2) already exists. Trap (3,2) to cover southern approach. Actually trap is blocked when adjacent to enemy - Bolt is at (4,5), dist 2 from (4,3), not adjacent. I can trap. Trap (5,3) to block Remedy/Aegis path, but that's outside range 2 from current pos. From (4,3), trap range ≤2: can reach (4,1),(4,2) already trapped,(3,3),(5,3),(4,4),(3,4),(5,4). Trap (5,4) where Remedy stands? No, must be empty tile. Trap (4,4) to block Bolt advancing south, then consider move.

I'm at 1/12 HP — critically wounded and in danger. No heals left. Snare is adjacent at (3,3) and wounded. Enemies Bolt and Remedy are nearby at dist=2. I need to survive. I can use overclock on Snare to boost the damage dealer, then move away from enemies toward safety. Moving to (2,5) gets me away from Bolt(4,5) and Remedy(5,4). First I'll overclock Snare who is adjacent at (3,3), then flee to (2,5).

Patch is unavailable (0 uses left). Both allies are wounded but not adjacent. Bolt at (4,5) is dist=2, Aegis at (5,2) is dist=2. Orders say stay adjacent to most threatened ally — Bolt has only 3/5 HP (60%) but Aegis has 5/8 (62.5%), so Bolt is more threatened. Move to (4,4) puts me adjacent to Bolt at (4,5). From there I can use overclock on Bolt (the damage dealer) since I can't heal. Rampart is adjacent now but wounded — I should move away toward Bolt rather than attacking.

I'm OVERCLOCKED with 2 ability uses. Pulse (medic) is critical at distance 2 — perfect precision_shot range from current position. I haven't moved so precision_shot deals full 2dmg, which should finish off a critical target. Snare is 3 tiles away so not adjacent — precision_shot is not blocked. Use both ability uses on Pulse first, then Rampart (wounded, dist 3, in range).

Rampart is adjacent at (5,3) and wounded — attack to finish them. I'm fortified and haven't moved, so I keep 50% damage reduction. Staying put and using shield_wall facing N protects against Rampart and any northern threats. Attack first to deal damage, then shield_wall N to protect allies from the enemy cluster.

I'm overclocked with 2 ability uses. Remedy is in range at (4,4) - I can trap between us or use pulse. Aegis is at (5,2) where I already have a trap. Enemies are clustered somewhat in the east. I should use pulse on Remedy since she's adjacent distance 2 (wait, pulse is 1 tile AoE - need to be within 1 tile). Remedy is at dist 2, so pulse won't reach. Best play: trap (4,4) to block Remedy's path, then trap another approach tile. Actually trap (4,3) to block the corridor toward Rampart at (5,3). With 2 ability uses I can place 2 traps. Trap (4,4) directly on Remedy's position - wait, trap goes on empty tile. Remedy is ON (4,4). Trap (3,4) to catch Remedy if she moves west, and trap (4,3) to threaten the corridor to Rampart.

At 3/8 HP with fortify active, I need to be cautious. Aegis is adjacent at (5,2) — I can attack it. I'm already fortified so I should avoid moving if possible to keep the damage reduction. Attack Aegis first, then shield_wall facing south to block any counterattack from Aegis/Remedy cluster.

Patch is unavailable (0/3 uses left). Bolt at (4,5) is critically wounded at 2/5 HP and adjacent to me — I should use overclock on Bolt to let them act twice next turn, maximizing damage output. Snare is at (3,3), dist=2, so I must avoid moving to (3,4) or (4,3) which would put me adjacent to Snare and block abilities. I'll stay at current position and use overclock on Bolt at (4,5) which is adjacent.

I'm at 1HP with OVERCLOCKED giving 2 ability uses. Both enemies are at dist=3, within precision_shot range (≤2 tiles... wait, dist=3 is out of range 2). Let me reconsider — precision_shot range is ≤2 tiles, but both enemies are at dist=3. I need to check suppressing_fire range too (≤2 tiles). Neither ability can reach from current position. I should move closer to Rampart (wounded, priority) to get in range, then use precision_shot. Moving to (5,4) puts me dist=1 from Rampart at (5,3) — that's adjacent, enabling attack. But Snare at (3,3) would be dist=2 from (5,4) — not adjacent so no denial. From (5,4): Rampart at (5,3) is dist=1 (adjacent), I can use precision_shot but I moved so it deals 1dmg. Rampart is wounded so 1dmg might finish them. Use both ability slots on precision_shot targeting Rampart twice with OVERCLOCKED.

Rampart is adjacent at (5,3) and critical — attack to finish them off. I'm fortified so I should not move to keep 50% damage reduction. Shield_wall facing N to protect Bolt behind me from Rampart's potential counterattack, but Rampart is already critical so attack is priority. Attack Rampart first, then shield_wall N to block any remaining threat from that direction.

Remedy is in range at (4,4) - that's my priority target. I can use pulse from current position to hit Remedy at dist=2... wait, pulse only hits within 1 tile. So I need to move closer. If I move to (3,4) - wait, that has a trap. Move to (4,3) - also has a trap. Move to (2,4) to stay safe, but that doesn't help range. Actually, Remedy is at (4,4) and I'm at (3,3) - dist=2. My attack range is adjacent only (1 tile), pulse is 1 tile AoE. So I need to get adjacent to Remedy to attack or pulse. If I move to (4,3) - trapped. Move to (3,4) - trapped. I can't safely move adjacent. But wait - I can use trap ability to place a mine. Remedy is at (4,4), I could trap an adjacent tile to funnel. Actually I already have traps at (4,3) and (3,4) which are adjacent to Remedy. The area around Remedy is well-trapped.
